item.title: Report E-2025030466
item.description:
Report E-2025030466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025031326
item.description:
Report X-2025031326

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was a plastic bag with vermiculite and three glass bottles in their own plastic bags. One bottle spilled its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
